Description:
The FHIR Procedure resource defines an activity performed on or with a patient as part of the provision of care. It corresponds with surgeries and procedures performed, including endoscopies and biopsies, as well as less invasive actions like counseling and physiotherapy. Because terminology codes for procedures are often billing related, some procedures might not have a terminology code, especially when billing activities are not performed within Epic.

This resource is designed for a high-level summarization around the occurrence of a procedure, and not for specific procedure log documentation - a concept that does not yet have a defined FHIR Resource. When searching, only completed procedures are returned.

The read interaction enables the lookup of a Procedure resource by a constant server ID. The read interaction allows clients to store only the server ID, and with a single request, retrieve the most up-to-date information about a procedure. Read interactions typically begin with a client having previously established a relationship, typically when following a reference to this resource from another resource or through querying for procedures through the search interaction.

A user or staff member accessing this FHIR resource must have security to view orders, results, and procedure reports.

A MyChart user accessing this FHIR resource must be authorized to view procedures in MyChart.

asserter.Name: asserter
asserter.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource who asserts this procedure.

bodySite.Name: bodySite
bodySite.Description: Procedure operative region for all panels.

category.Name: category
category.Description: A code that classifies the procedure. This will always be SNOMED code 103693007 (Diagnostic procedure) for the Procedure (Orders) API.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: Reference to an Encounter resource associated with the Procedure.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: System-specific ID for the procedure order record.

outcome.Name: outcome
outcome.Description: Discharge disposition from the linked ADT contact.

performedPeriod.Name: performedPeriod
performedPeriod.Description: The length of time the procedure was performed.

actor.Name: actor
actor.Description: Reference to the Practitioner that performed the procedure. The reading physicians or, if unavailable, the resulting physician.

reasonCode.Name: reasonCode
reasonCode.Description: External codes for diagnosis records associated with the procedure.

recorder.Name: recorder
recorder.Description: Reference to the Practitioner resource who recorded the procedure.

report.Name: report
report.Description: Reference to the diagnostic report resource.

status.Name: status
status.Description:
The status of the Procedure.

API Value FHIR Event Status
cancelled stopped
active in-progress
completed completed
aborted stopped

*Note: Omitted FHIR event status equivalent values are not returned by this search

statusReason.Name: statusReason
statusReason.Description: The reason that a procedure was not performed, which is sent only when the status is Stopped.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: Reference to the Patient resource for whom this Procedure resource is relevant.
